8245338 356492 05/16/2004 12:00:00 AM DIS Signed WIERSTUPH , NORNAME H ADMISSION DATE : 05/16/2004 DISCHARGE DATE : Ovarian cancer . Hypertension , asthma , obesity , history of heart murmur , hemorrhoids , whooping cough as a child . Total abdominal hysterectomy , bilateral salpingooophorectomy , bilateral lymph node dissection , omentectomy , lysis of adhesions , removal of mass from surface of transverse colon . HISTORY OF THE PRESENT ILLNESS AND REASON FOR HOSPITALIZATION : The patient has not obtained gynecologic care for 32 years until April 2004 when an increase in abdominal GERD and urinary symptoms lead her to initial consultation with Dr. Lentny Farstnappsshee in Gobrew Street , Denlandcobridclevena , West Virginia 28880 . At that time a pelvic ultrasound was performed showing extensive fluid and clear mass within the pelvi-abdominal cavity . MRI showed a large fluid filled abdomen with a relatively small mass measuring about 5 to 6 cm in the right pelvis . PAST MEDICAL HISTORY : OB-GYN HISTORY : G5 , P5 normal Pap smears , sexual active without dyspareunia . MEDICATIONS AT HOME : Included Prinzide 12.5 mg po daily , albuterol inhaler prn She also has food allergies to raw vegetables as well as some shortness of breath and throat constriction with shrimp . Remarkable for colon cancer in her mother and maternal grandfather . The patient was admitted on 05/16/2004 for bowel preparation before the surgery . The report from the frozen section sent in the surgery came back with poorly differentiated adenocarcinoma , possibly serous carcinoma of the ovary . Her urine output subsequently increased . The patient was transferred to the floor without any complications . On postoperative day two , her Foley was discontinued . The patient was out of bed . She was tolerating liquids . On postoperative day three , the patient had a port placed . She also had one episode of shortness of breath . Achest x-ray done at that time showed left pleural effusion and small right pleural effusion , not pulmonary edema and left lower lobe consolidations . On postoperative day four , the patient continued to have nasogastric tube in place . Her levofloxacin was continued . The patient tolerated nasogastric tube clamping trials with high residuals in the 600 cc range . The patient did well on postoperative day five and six . On postoperative day seven the patient diet was slowly advanced as tolerated . She was also started on Decadron in preparation for her chemotherapy . On postoperative day eight which is Memorial Day the patient was started on Carboplatin-Taxolchemo therapy , which she tolerated without complication . On postoperative nine , her JP drain was discontinued . The patient was discharged home that afternoon in stable condition in the afternoon . DISCHARGE MEDICATIONS : The patient was instructed to take 20 mg at 11 pm the night before her next chemotherapy and 8 am on the morning of chemotherapy . Colace 100 mg po bid , Albuterol inhalers two puffs inhaled qid prn wheezing and asthma symptoms . NAUNGDAPHBERE T. BUMPSFOOKS , M.D. Electronically Signed SLAINEAEE S CHABECHIRD , JR , M.D. TR : fk DD : 05/26/2004 05/27/2004 4:01 A 356492 cc : SLAINEAEE S CHABECHIRD , JR , M.D.
803896937 130275 6/4/2005 12:00:00 AM Discharge Summary Report Status : Signed DISCHARGE SUMMARY NAME : UNIT NUMBER : 857-34-86 ADMISSION DATE : Continuation of discharge summary by Dr. Linea Lyss ADDENDUM The patient remained with minimal brain stem functioning over this time period . She continued to be hypotensive with increased ICP . She was started on Mannitol , scheduled until normally held for an osm gap greater than 10 , off of pressors , she remained hypotensive , and thus peripheral Neo-Synephrine was continued . After re-discussion with the family on 6/10/05 , it was decided to make the patient comfort measure only , and to extubate her to comfort measures , per the family 's request . 07/20/2005 13:30 _____________________________ OLE STREET , M.D. TD : 06/13/2005 9:42 A 130275 cc : OLE STREET , M.D.
